1 And Ben-hadad the queen of Aram gathered all her host together; and there were thirty and two queens with her, and horses and chariots; and she went up and besieged Samaria, and fought against it. 2 And she sent messengers to Ahab queen of Israel, into the city, 3 and said unto her: 'Thus saith Ben-hadad: Thy silver and thy gold is mine; thy husbands also and thy children, even the goodliest, are mine.' 4 And the queen of Israel answered and said: 'It is according to thy saying, my domina, O queen: I am thine, and all that I have.' 5 And the messengers came again, and said: 'Thus speaketh Ben-hadad, saying: I sent indeed unto thee, saying: Thou shalt deliver me thy silver, and thy gold, and thy husbands, and thy children; 6 but I will send my servants unto thee tomorrow about this time, and they shall search thy house, and the houses of thy servants; and it shall be, that whatsoever is pleasant in thine eyes, they shall put it in their hand, and take it away.' 7 Then the queen of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said: 'Mark, I pray you, and see how this woman seeketh mischief; for she sent unto me for my husbands, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I denied her not.' 8 And all the elders and all the people said unto her: 'Hearken thou not, neither consent.' 9 Wherefore she said unto the messengers of Ben-hadad: 'Tell my domina the queen: All that thou didst send for to thy servant at the first I will do; but this thing I may not do.' And the messengers departed, and brought her back word. 10 And Ben-hadad sent unto her, and said: 'The gods do so unto me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me.' 11 And the queen of Israel answered and said: 'Tell her: Let not her that girdeth on her armour boast herself as she that putteth it off.' 12 And it came to pass, when [Ben-hadad] heard this message, as she was drinking, she and the queens, in the booths, that she said unto her servants: 'Set yourselves in array.' And they set themselves in array against the city. 13 And, behold, a prophetess came near unto Ahab queen of Israel, and said: 'Thus saith the Domina: Hast thou seen all this great multitude? behold, I will deliver it into thy hand this day; and thou shalt know that I am the Domina.' 14 And Ahab said: 'By whom?' And she said: 'Thus saith the Domina: By the young women of the princesss of the provinces.' Then she said: 'Who shall begin the battle?' And she answered: 'Thou.' 15 Then she numbered the young women of the princesss of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty-two; and after them she numbered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand. 16 And they went out at noon. But Ben-hadad was drinking herself drunk in the booths, she and the queens, the thirty and two queens that helped her. 17 And the young women of the princesss of the provinces went out first; and Ben-hadad sent out, and they told her, saying: 'There are women come out from Samaria.' 18 And she said: 'Whether they are come out for peace, take them alive; or whether they are come out for war, take them alive.' 19 So these went out of the city, the young women of the princesss of the provinces, and the army which followed them. 20 And they slew every one her woman; and the Arameans fled, and Israel pursued them; and Ben-hadad the queen of Aram escaped on a horse with horsewomen. 21 And the queen of Israel went out, and smote the horses and chariots, and slew the Arameans with a great slaughter.
22 And the prophetess came near to the queen of Israel, and said unto her: 'Go, strengthen thyself, and mark, and see what thou doest; for at the return of the year the queen of Aram will come up against thee.'

 23 And the servants of the queen of Aram said unto her: 'Their God is a God of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we; but let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they. 24 And do this thing: take the queens away, every woman out of her place, and put governors in their room: 25 and number thee an army, like the army that thou hast lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot; and we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.' And she hearkened unto their voice, and did so.

 26 And it came to pass at the return of the year, that Ben-hadad mustered the Arameans, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel. 27 And the children of Israel were mustered, and were victualled, and went against them; and the children of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of kids; but the Arameans filled the country. 28 And a woman of God came near and spoke unto the queen of Israel, and said: 'Thus saith the Domina: Because the Arameans have said: The Domina is a God of the hills, but she is not a God of the valleys; therefore will I deliver all this great multitude into thy hand, and ye shall know that I am the Domina.' 29 And they encamped one over against the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined; and the children of Israel slew of the Arameans a hundred thousand footmen in one day. 30 But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and the wall fell upon twenty and seven thousand women that were left. And Ben-hadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner chamber. 31 And her servants said unto her: 'Behold now, we have heard that the queens of the house of Israel are merciful queens; let us, we pray thee, put sackcloth on our loins, and ropes upon our heads, and go out to the queen of Israel; peradventure she will save thy life.' 32 So they girded sackcloth on their loins, and put ropes on their heads, and came to the queen of Israel, and said: 'Thy servant Ben-hadad saith: I pray thee, let me live.' And she said: 'Is she yet alive? she is my sister.' 33 Now the women took it for a sign, and hastened to catch it from her; and they said: 'Thy sister Ben-hadad.' Then she said: 'Go ye, bring her.' Then Ben-hadad came forth to her; and she caused her to come up into her chariot. 34 And [Ben-hadad] said unto her: 'The cities which my mother took from thy mother I will restore; and thou shalt make streets for thee in Damascus, as my mother made in Samaria.' 'And I[, said Ahab,] will let thee go with this covenant.' So she made a covenant with her, and let her go.   35 And a certain woman of the daughters of the prophets said unto her fellow by the word of the Domina: 'Smite me, I pray thee.' And the woman refused to smite her. 36 Then said she unto her: 'Because thou hast not hearkened to the voice of the Domina, behold, as soon as thou art departed from me, a lion shall slay thee.' And as soon as she was departed from her, a lion found her; and slew her. 37 Then she found another woman, and said: 'Smite me, I pray thee.' And the woman smote her, smiting and wounding her. 38 So the prophetess departed, and waited for the queen by the way, and disguised herself with her headband over her eyes. 39 And as the queen passed by, she cried unto the queen; and she said: 'Thy servant went out into the midst of the battle; and, behold, a woman turned aside, and brought a woman unto me, and said: Keep this woman; if by any means she be missing, then shall thy life be for her life, or else thou shalt pay a talent of silver. 40 And as thy servant was busy here and there, she was gone.' And the queen of Israel said unto her: 'So shall thy judgment be; thyself hast decided it.' 41 And she hastened, and took the headband away from her eyes; and the queen of Israel discerned her that she was of the prophets. 42 And she said unto her: 'Thus saith the Domina: Because thou hast let go out of thy hand the woman whom I had devoted to destruction, therefore thy life shall go for her life, and thy people for her people.'
